title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 16
author: Various
snippet: These were intending purchasers,whose respect for poor Waterstone, and whose sympathy for his unhappysituation, induced them thus to keep aloof, with the view of saving hisfeelings as much as possible, until their purpose there should render itnecessary for them to approach nearer to the melancholy scene.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 16
author: Various
snippet: These, however, were equally unattended to with the others; and it isnot, therefore, to be wondered at that old Waterstone should havecharged his son with ingratitude, and considered his conduct undutifuland unnatural.
